metadata.Title: CVE-2021-0447 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
[Unknown description]

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-0447` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-186.216
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-186.216
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1077.84
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1111.123
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-1102-aws - 4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1071-oracle - 4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1136-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1136.145
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1140-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1140.148
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-186.216').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-24.26~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1077.84').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1111.123').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1030.31~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1013.13~16.04.2').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1014.14~16.04.1').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1007.9~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1136.145').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1140.148').
